fault-trees.title: Fault Tree Analysis
fault-trees.description: Fault Tree Analysis (FTA) is a top-down, deductive failure analysis method used to determine the causes of system-level failures.

gsn.title: Goal Structured Notation (GSN)
gsn.description: Goal Structured Notation is a graphical argumentation notation used to explicitly document safety arguments and their supporting evidence.

guidelines/hazard-identification.title: Hazard Identification Guidelines
guidelines/hazard-identification.description: This guide provides best practices for identifying and documenting hazards in your safety management system.

guidelines/risk-assessment.title: Risk Assessment Guidelines
guidelines/risk-assessment.description: Risk assessment is the process of evaluating identified hazards to determine their significance and prioritize mitigation efforts.

guidelines/safety-documentation.title: Safety Documentation Guidelines
guidelines/safety-documentation.description: Comprehensive documentation is essential for effective safety management, regulatory compliance, and continuous improvement.

hazards.title: Hazard Information
hazards.description: The Hazard Information module provides a comprehensive registry for tracking and managing identified hazards throughout your system's lifecycle.

intro.title: Introduction
intro.description: Welcome to the Safety Dashboard Documentation. This comprehensive safety management system provides tools and visualizations for managing hazards, analyzing fault trees, tracking performance indicators, and building safety cases.

performance-indicators.title: Safety Performance Indicators
performance-indicators.description: Safety Performance Indicators (SPIs) are metrics used to monitor and measure the effectiveness of safety management systems.
